snippet: In 2012, the share of income that was donated by Americans earning $200,000 or more fell 4.6 percent since 2006, but it rose 4.5 percent among those earning less than $100,000.
abstract: Study released by Chronicle of Philanthropy finds that the share of income donated to charity by Americans who earned $200,000 or more decreased by 4.6 percent since 2006; those earning less than $100,000 gave 4.5 percent more of their income to charity.
lead_paragraph: In 2012, the share of income that was donated by Americans earning $200,000 or more fell 4.6 percent since 2006, but it rose 4.5 percent among those earning less than $100,000.

headline.main: Study Finds Shifts in Charitable Giving After Recession
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Shifts in Charitable Giving After Recession
